mlrng 0.1
  • Get started
  • Reference

Dictionary of defined Tasks

mlr.tasks.Rd

Tasks is a Dictionary() used to manage tasks.

mlr.tasks

Format

R6Class() object

Examples

# List task ids:
mlr.tasks$ids
#> [1] "bh"    "iris"  "pima"  "sonar" "spam"  "zoo"  

# Get a briew summary:
mlr.tasks$summary()
#>       id task.type nrow ncol
#> 1:    bh      regr  506   14
#> 2:  iris   classif  150    5
#> 3:  pima   classif  768    9
#> 4: sonar   classif  208   61
#> 5:  spam   classif 4601   58
#> 6:   zoo   classif  101   17

# Retrieve a specific task:
mlr.tasks$get("iris")
#> Classification Supervised Task
#> Target: Species 
#> Warning: Missing values are always removed in SQL.
#> Use `SUM(x, na.rm = TRUE)` to silence this warning
#> Warning: Missing values are always removed in SQL.
#> Use `SUM(x, na.rm = TRUE)` to silence this warning
#> Warning: Missing values are always removed in SQL.
#> Use `SUM(x, na.rm = TRUE)` to silence this warning
#> Warning: Missing values are always removed in SQL.
#> Use `SUM(x, na.rm = TRUE)` to silence this warning
#> Warning: Missing values are always removed in SQL.
#> Use `SUM(x, na.rm = TRUE)` to silence this warning
#> Task name: iris
#> 150 rows and 4 features.
#> Features: Sepal.Length,Sepal.Width,Petal.Length,Petal.Width
#> Feature types: 4 numeric
#> Missings: FALSE 
#> 
#>  <TaskClassif>
#>   Inherits from: <TaskSupervised>
#>   Public:
#>     backend: BackendDBI, Backend, R6
#>     classes: active binding
#>     clone: function (deep = FALSE) 
#>     col.types: active binding
#>     data: active binding
#>     features: active binding
#>     formula: active binding
#>     get: function (rows = NULL, cols = NULL) 
#>     head: function (n = 6L) 
#>     id: iris
#>     initialize: function (id = deparse(substitute(data)), data, target, positive) 
#>     missing.values: active binding
#>     nclasses: active binding
#>     ncol: active binding
#>     nrow: active binding
#>     positive: NA
#>     print: function (...) 
#>     subset: function (rows = NULL, cols = NULL) 
#>     target: Species
#>     task.type: classif
#>     truth: function (rows = NULL)  

# Add a new task, based on a subset of iris:
data = iris
data$Species = ifelse(data$Species == "setosa", "1", "0")
task = TaskClassif$new("iris.binary", data = data, target = "Species")
task$nclasses
#> [1] 2
mlr.tasks$add(task)
mlr.tasks$summary()
#>             id task.type nrow ncol
#> 1:          bh      regr  506   14
#> 2:        iris   classif  150    5
#> 3: iris.binary   classif  150    5
#> 4:        pima   classif  768    9
#> 5:       sonar   classif  208   61
#> 6:        spam   classif 4601   58
#> 7:         zoo   classif  101   17
mlr.tasks$remove("iris.binary")
